TopicTitle: Modding Mondays - Bonus Edition: Kerbal Sound Overhaul Project

Articles.Content:
<p><img alt="image" src="http://media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_mwizkqwVL61rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>****** <iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/_okamRI_KH0" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>With the MAVEN out on its mission, it’s time to focus on mods and matters back on Kerbal. pizzaoverhead’s <a href="http://bit.ly/I3wwwS"><strong>Kerbal Sound Overhaul Project</strong></a> is a series of mods aimed at increasing the realism and overall enjoyment of <em><strong>KSP</strong></em> through the use of audio additions/improvements, as well as new visual cues.</p>

<p>The project is ongoing, but has thus far produced some spectacular results:</p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/18NotKN"><strong>Audio Muffler</strong></a> - produces silence/dulls noise while out in space. <a href="http://bit.ly/17m47Le"><strong>Chatterer</strong></a> - adds background conversations with mission control and <a href="http://bit.ly/17JxcNU"><strong>Cockpit Warning Modifications</strong></a> - adds all sorts of indicator lights and sounds that will hopefully keep your ship out of harm’s way.</p>

<p>This is just a sample of what the <strong>Kerbal Sound Overhaul Project</strong> has in store. To view all of the mods in the project, click <a href="http://bit.ly/I3wwwS"><strong>here</strong></a>.</p>
Cool looking mod, I'll have to try it out.

We appreciate the bonus modding monday! This was a quality entry that shows you appreciate community input. You have my respect SQUAD

Edited November 20, 2013 by BlazingAngel665
